summary: Richard N. Billings was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports that list Billings as an employee. These documents span from April 1978 to December 1978, indicating his employment with the committee during that period. The reports include his name, social security number, annual salary, and gross pay.
significance: Richard N. Billings' significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the provided documents do not specify his role within the committee, his presence on payroll and certification reports indicates he was a staff member involved in the investigation of the JFK assassination.
